H0.text: What is the common word for the monosaccharide substance found in certain fruit, flower nectar and honey, with the chemical formula C6H12O6. Glucose

H1.text: What is the common word for the monosaccharide substance found in certain fruit, flower nectar and honey, with the chemical formula C6H12O6. Sucrose

H2.text: What is the common word for the monosaccharide substance found in certain fruit, flower nectar and honey, with the chemical formula C6H12O6. Maltose

H3.text: What is the common word for the monosaccharide substance found in certain fruit, flower nectar and honey, with the chemical formula C6H12O6. Fructose

A4.text: Fructose is a monosaccharide found in fruits, honey, and flower nectar.

A5.text: Sucrose is a disaccharide composed of glucose and fructose.
